But here’s how one woman celebrates the good.</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/east-st-louis-had-tough-one-woman-celebrates-130001322.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="East St. Louis has had it tough. But here’s how one woman celebrates the good." align="left" title="East St. Louis has had it tough. But here’s how one woman celebrates the good." border="0" ></a>Charmaine Savage wouldn’t want to start a conversation about herself with grim stereotypes of East St. Louis, Ill., her hometown.  A once-prosperous manufacturing, rail, and shipping center, East St. Louis had a peak population of 80,000 around 1950.  This town has nurtured African-American icons – from jazz great Miles Davis and singer Tina Turner, to Olympic track star Jackie Joyner-Kersee and renowned sports and race sociologist Harry Edwards, to former US Ambassador to the United Nations Donald McHenry.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/east-st-louis-had-tough-one-woman-celebrates-130001322.html</link><pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 08:00:01 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.csmonitor.com/">Christian Science Monitor</source><guid isPermaLink="false">east-st-louis-had-tough-one-woman-celebrates-130001322.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/east-st-louis-had-tough-one-woman-celebrates-130001322.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="East St. Louis has had it tough. But here’s how one woman celebrates the good." align="left" title="East St. Louis has had it tough. But here’s how one woman celebrates the good." border="0" ></a>Charmaine Savage wouldn’t want to start a conversation about herself with grim stereotypes of East St. Louis, Ill., her hometown.  A once-prosperous manufacturing, rail, and shipping center, East St. Louis had a peak population of 80,000 around 1950.  This town has nurtured African-American icons – from jazz great Miles Davis and singer Tina Turner, to Olympic track star Jackie Joyner-Kersee and renowned sports and race sociologist Harry Edwards, to former US Ambassador to the United Nations Donald McHenry.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>Hoping American values will outshine the St. Louis, we care about you and all the residents.  Recommended:  Could you pass a US citizenship test?<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item><item><title>The stark message behind Mueller indictment of 13 Russians</title><description><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/stark-message-behind-mueller-indictment-13-russians-215300078.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="The stark message behind Mueller indictment of 13 Russians" align="left" title="The stark message behind Mueller indictment of 13 Russians" border="0" ></a>Special counsel Robert Mueller on Friday indicted 13 Russians, and three Russian organizations, with meddling in the 2016 US election.  The charges centered on the alleged use of social media to sow political discord, via inserting politically charged messages into the stream of American electronic discourse.<p><br clear="all"></description><link>https://www.yahoo.com/news/stark-message-behind-mueller-indictment-13-russians-215300078.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 16:53:00 -0500</pubDate><source url="http://www.csmonitor.com/">Christian Science Monitor</source><guid isPermaLink="false">stark-message-behind-mueller-indictment-13-russians-215300078.html</guid><media:content height="86" url="" width="130"/><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://www.yahoo.com/news/stark-message-behind-mueller-indictment-13-russians-215300078.html"><img src="" width="130" height="86" alt="The stark message behind Mueller indictment of 13 Russians" align="left" title="The stark message behind Mueller indictment of 13 Russians" border="0" ></a>Special counsel Robert Mueller on Friday indicted 13 Russians, and three Russian organizations, with meddling in the 2016 US election.  The charges centered on the alleged use of social media to sow political discord, via inserting politically charged messages into the stream of American electronic discourse.<p><br clear="all"></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"/></item></channel></rss>
